text: in my never-ending quest for the perfect
cookie today I'm making a lemon
refrigerator cookie I don't know if I
found the ultimate cookie yet but this
is very very close it's a delicious
tangy zesty mega head lemon cookie start
off by zesting your lemon you'll need a
tablespoon plus a teaspoon otherwise
known as four teaspoons of very finely
grated lemon zest it's funny you know
sometimes a lemon will yield a ton of
zest and sometimes you don't even get
like two teaspoons from a lemon I guess
it's kind of like lemon juice quirky
that way but it's always good to have on
hand a ton of lemons because they're
good not just for your cookies but
finishing all kinds of dishes savory
sweet everything about a tablespoon ish
I would say and you'll need a teaspoon
of lemon juice in this food processor I
have two cups of all-purpose flour and
to that I'm adding one cup of
confectioner's sugar confectioner sugar
gives your cookies a kind of sandy
crumbly texture that is so fantastic I
love it a teaspoon of salt
give that a pulse you want all the
ingredients fully combined here so good
make sure you always put salt in your
cookies if your cookie recipe does not
call for salt at at least a half a
teaspoon the flavor improvement will be
spot-on two sticks of unsalted butter
that's been cut into small pieces
make sure you add that lemon zest I was

separate two eggs is that the nice

then process until a dough forms now
you're going to want to roll this and

and is sliceable so you can do that in
some plastic wrap divide your dough in

into nice even logs you can start off by
sort of rolling it with your hand in the
plastic should be about an inch an inch
and a half and diameter it kind of
doesn't matter it's up to you and then
if you pull it towards you on the board
in the plastic wrap sort of firms up the
shape looks like a little polenta log
right second log same thing give it a
little roll just want to get them nice
and even they need to chill you can
freeze these but you want to make sure
that they chill in the refrigerator for
at least two hours or you can freeze
them for no three months I would say
make sure your cookie dough gets nice
and firm have a little bit of sugar on
hand you want to roll the outside in

roll it in some sugar this is about a

your cookie dough about a quarter inch
thick you can make them slightly thinner
if you want something just a little bit
more elegant that's okay this dough
actually cuts really really well
sometimes you make a refrigerator cookie
and it sort of crumbles as you're
